DOCNAME: CASE OF SADIK ÖNDER v. TURKEY
CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 3;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award;Costs and expenses partial award - Convention proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant is born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant with CARDINAL other people was taken into police custody by the Anti - Terror branch of ORG on suspicion of being a member of the ORG .

CARDINAL . The applicant alleges that he was ill - treated and tortured in the police car on the way to ORG and during his detention there . He claims that during his interrogation , he was blindfolded and stripped naked . He was strung up by his arms in the form of torture known as “ NORP hanging ” . His head was hit against the wall and he was held parallel to the ground on his hands and feet . He was also electrocuted , threatened and insulted .

CARDINAL . NORP The applicant further claims that he was coerced into signing a statement in which it was stated that he had worked for and had been involved in the terrorist activities of the ORG . After having signed the statement prepared by the police , he was allegedly kept in custody for DATE so that the signs of the ill - treatment to which he had been subjected would disappear . During DATE , he claims that a police officer came to his cell at regular intervals and applied a medicine on his wounds in order to cover up the signs of ill - treatment . He claims that due to this medicine his scars healed very quickly .
CARDINAL . The Government submit that the applicant was questioned by the police on DATE . They have produced a copy of a statement signed by the applicant on this occasion .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant together with CARDINAL other detainees was examined by PERSON at ORG . According to the medical report prepared by PERSON , the applicant showed no signs of ill - treatment .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was brought before ORG at ORG . According to the records of this hearing , the applicant admitted that he had been involved with ORG related activities in the past and had been convicted on that account by ORG in DATE . He denied having any current relation with the ORG . He stated that the police invented the statement taken in custody .

CARDINAL . The applicant alleges that he was brought to ORG at ORG together with the other detainees on DATE but that ORG did not take his statement because he had complained to the prosecutor that he had been tortured in police custody . He further stated that because he told to the prosecutor that he was subjected to torture , he was once again tortured by the police . The Government contested this argument and stated that the applicant was brought for the first time before ORG on DATE .

CARDINAL . The applicant alleges that he told the prosecutor on DATE of his subjection to torture but that his statement was not taken into consideration by ORG and was not written down on the hearing records .

CARDINAL . The applicant further stated that he was not seen by a doctor before being questioned by the Prosecutor on DATE and consequently he does not have any medical evidence concerning the torture he was subjected to on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was also brought before the Judge at ORG . He denied the allegations against him and stated that he was not a member of the ORG . He further declared that the statement he gave to ORG was true . The Judge ordered his detention on remand .

CARDINAL . The applicant claims that he told ORG Judge that he had been tortured in police custody and that he had explained this to ORG at ORG . However the case files show that the applicant did not claim to have being subjected to ill - treatment neither before ORG nor ORG .

CARDINAL . While the applicant was held in detention in prison , he requested to see a doctor . The prison doctor prepared a provisional report for the applicant and he was sent to ORG for a medical examination .

CARDINAL . On DATE the medical report prepared by the institution and signed by the medical expert stated that the applicant complained of widespread pain on his back , right arm and on both of his legs but that he could not find any signs of traumatic lesions . The medical report further stated that the complaints were not life threatening but accorded him DATE sick leave .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE ( GPE Tabib Odası ) , in the context of disciplinary proceedings following complaints , found that PERSON had concealed signs of torture in the medical examinations conducted on several persons DATE and DATE and he was , therefore , prohibited from practising as a doctor for DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG at ORG filed an indictment with the court , requesting that the court to apply Articles CARDINAL § § CARDINAL and CARDINAL and CARDINAL of LAW and LAW .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant filed a complaint with ORG . He alleged that he had been ill - treated while in police custody and requested that proceedings be instituted against the police officers . He submitted the medical report of CARDINAL DATE as proof of his ill - treatment .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , referring to the medical report of ORG , gave a decision of non - prosecution on account of lack of evidence .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant filed an objection with ORG against ORG decision .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant 's objections .
